title: Iff is Symmetric
description:
Prove that logical equivalence (`<->`) is symmetric: if `P <-> Q` then `Q <-> P`.

**Goal:** `forall P Q : Prop, (P <-> Q) -> (Q <-> P)`

Recall that `P <-> Q` is defined as `(P -> Q) /\ (Q -> P)`. You need to decompose the hypothesis and rebuild the equivalence with the directions swapped.
hints: Use `intros P Q H` then `destruct H as [HPQ HQP]` to get both directions, or use the pattern `intros P Q [HPQ HQP]`
Use `split` to prove each direction of the new iff separately â€” each is already one of your hypotheses

solution:
Theorem iff_symmetric : forall P Q : Prop, (P <-> Q) -> (Q <-> P).
Proof.
  intros P Q [HPQ HQP].
  split.
  - exact HQP.
  - exact HPQ.
Qed.
